lol, don't know roman numerals? 

1=I
2=II
3+III
4=IV
5=V
6=VI
7=VII
8=VIII
9=IX
10=X
11=XI
12=XII .. can you guess what 13 is?
14=XIV
15=XV
16, 17 and 18... can you guess?
19=XIX
20=XX
50=L , so 40 is XL (50 minus 10, just like 4 is VI, or 5 minus 1)
and 60 is LX or 50 plus 10 , like six is five plus one.. or "VI"
65 is LXV, and 68 is LXVIII
88 is LXXXVIII
89 is LXXXIX
90 is XC, because C is 100 (cent)
500 is D
1000 is M .. all the numbers in between follows the base number(V,X,L,C,D,M) plus or minus the variable of lower value, listed before one less than the base number, and after is one higher
...if you need more help than this, go back to grade school.. or google it if you have any self respect.
